step1.sentence: I need to work on my presentation before the meeting tomorrow.

step2.story: Jake had been putting off his school project for weeks. Finally, he sat down at his desk and decided to work on it all weekend. By Sunday evening, he felt proud of what he had accomplished.

step3.story: Mia stared at the half-finished painting on her easel, feeling stuck. She hadn't touched it in over a month, and the colors were starting to feel foreign. One rainy afternoon, she poured herself a cup of coffee and decided to work on it without any pressure. Slowly, her brush found its rhythm again. Hours passed without her noticing, and by evening the painting had transformed into something she truly loved. Sometimes, all it takes is showing up and letting the process guide you.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 'work'(일하다) + 'on'(~위에) → 무언가 위에서 일하다, 즉 특정 대상에 노력을 기울이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 과제, 프로젝트, 기술 등을 개선하거나 완성하기 위해 시간과 노력을 들이는 것을 의미합니다. 'I'm working on it'은 '지금 하고 있어요'라는 뜻으로 일상에서 매우 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'work'는 고대 영어 'weorc'에서, 'on'은 방향·대상을 나타내는 전치사로, 두 단어가 결합하여 '특정 대상에 대해 작업하다'라는 구동사가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 일한다는 의미보다 특정 목표를 향해 꾸준히 노력한다는 뉘앙스가 있습니다. 격식/비격식 모두 자연스럽게 사용되며, 자기 개선의 맥락에서도 자주 쓰입니다 (예: work on yourself).
meaning.shortExampleEn: She's been working on her English skills every day.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 매일 영어 실력을 갈고닦고 있다.
